bio.name: Carolyn Napier
bio.why: I became a vegetarian when I was 18 just to see if I could do it. I soon realized how much healthier I was. I began to watch documentaries and read more about what actually happens to the animals. I wanted to live a compassionate lifestyle. When I was 21, I made the decision to become fully vegan.
bio.history: Battle over Redlands 2012 scaled division, 3rd place Fittest in OK 2013 Rx'd division, 5th place Red dirt classic- team division, 3rd place Battle over Redlands- Rx’d division, 7th place Fittest in OK 2014- team division, 6th place Anarchy in the OK- Rx’d, 3rd place KO in the OK- Rx’d team, 1st place Fittest in OK 2015- Rx’d team, 1st place Fittest Games- Rx’d team- 4th place I will be competing in the Central Regional in Minneapolis, MN.
bio.purpose: I am competitive by nature. I love training and competing to see how hard I can push myself.
bio.diet: it doesn’t change much from what I typically eat day to day.
bio.training: I typically train 3 days on, 1 day off. I will usually do my gym’s workout for the day and then do extra strength and accessory work plus another workout that focuses on my weaknesses.
bio.strongestSkill: handstand push ups and pull ups
bio.proud: My hard work over this last year to get better and making it with a team to go to regionals.
